diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,98 @@
+#include "torch/csrc/jit/fuser/interface.h"

+#include "torch/csrc/jit/fuser/config.h"
+#if USE_CUDA_FUSER || USE_CPU_FUSER

+  #include "torch/csrc/jit/fuser/executor.h"
+  #include "torch/csrc/jit/fuser/fallback.h"
+#endif // USE_CUDA_FUSER || USE_CPU_FUSER
+
+#include <stdexcept>
+
+namespace torch { namespace jit {
+
+namespace detail {
+
+// Note: CPU fusion is currently disabled due to test flakiness
+bool cpu_fuser_enabled = false;
+
+} // namespace detail
+
+int64_t registerFusion(const Node* fusion_group) {
+  #if USE_CUDA_FUSER || USE_CPU_FUSER
+    int64_t key;
+    fuser::registerFusion(key, fusion_group);
body: Can't this function return `key` as well? The fact that we have two function with this name, that are so similar, is very confusing
